reasons_to_visit.details: Experience Limerick's large St. Patrick's Day celebrations (March 17th). The city hosts a major parade, often featuring community groups, music, and pageantry, plus concerts and events over the festival weekend.
Witness the first signs of spring along the River Shannon and in People's Park. Daylight hours increase noticeably, offering more time for exploration as winter recedes.
March generally offers good value for accommodation and fewer crowds at attractions like King John's Castle compared to peak season (excluding St. Patrick's week).
Check Munster Rugby fixtures; home matches at Thomond Park bring a fantastic atmosphere to the city. Six Nations rugby may also conclude, creating excitement in pubs.
Unpredictable March weather makes it ideal for enjoying Limerick's pub scene. Find warmth, hearty food, and live music sessions, especially vibrant around St. Patrick's Day.
Explore Limerick's indoor attractions like King John's Castle, the Hunt Museum, St. Mary's Cathedral, Limerick Museum, or the City Gallery of Art on wetter days.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: March weather in Limerick is highly variable – expect potential wind, rain, and chilly temperatures, interspersed with occasional bright spells. Pack for all possibilities.
The period around March 17th is extremely busy. Pubs are packed, accommodation prices surge, and booking far in advance is essential.
While spring is emerging, surrounding countryside like Lough Gur might still appear more wintry than lush green.
If Easter falls in late March, expect increased crowds, potential peak pricing around the holiday weekend, and closures on Good Friday/Easter Monday.

weather.precipitation: Frequent rain and wind still common (average 80-90mm monthly). Can feel quite damp and cool. Frost possible.
weather.general_tips: Good waterproof and windproof outerwear is vital. Pack layers (fleece, sweaters), hat, gloves, scarf, and waterproof footwear.

tourism_level.crowds: Low to Moderate. Generally quiet, making it easy to explore attractions without queues.
tourism_level.pricing: Good shoulder season value for accommodation before the St. Patrick's Day price hike.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: City slowly waking up for spring. Longer days are noticeable. Pubs offer cozy refuge. Build-up to St. Patrick's Day later in the month.

events_holidays.name: Mother's Day (Ireland & UK)
events_holidays.description: Restaurants and cafes may be busier for Sunday lunch/afternoon tea. Book popular spots.
events_holidays.notes: Irish/UK date differs from US Mother's Day.

events_holidays.name: Six Nations Rugby Finals (Potentially)
events_holidays.description: Pubs screening final tournament matches (especially Ireland games) will be very busy and atmospheric.
events_holidays.notes: Check fixtures. Arrive early at popular sports pubs.

events_holidays.name: Munster Rugby Match (Check Schedule)
events_holidays.description: Potential for home games at Thomond Park.
events_holidays.notes: Match days create a huge buzz in the city.

unique_experiences.description: Discover Limerick's landmark castle and its rich history with fewer visitors than in peak season.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check opening hours. Allow 2-3 hours. Good indoor exhibits.

unique_experiences.description: Explore the diverse collection of art and antiquities in the elegant Custom House. Ideal for a rainy afternoon.
Admire Limerick's elegant Georgian architecture and perhaps visit the Limerick City Gallery of Art in Pery Square.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Wrap up warm. Easy walking on wide streets.

unique_experiences.activity: Enjoy Live Music in a Pub
unique_experiences.where: Various Pubs (e.g., Dolan's, The Locke Bar)
unique_experiences.description: Seek out a pub known for traditional Irish music sessions or other live acts. Enjoy the music and atmosphere.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check pub schedules for session times (often start later evening).

weather.precipitation: Highly variable weather continues. Rain is frequent, but chances of brighter, milder spells increase. Wind remains a factor.
weather.general_tips: Waterproofs and layers remain necessary. Be adaptable to changing conditions.

tourism_level.crowds: Extremely High around St. Patrick's Day (17th). Parade route and pubs will be very crowded. Quieter afterwards, unless Easter falls late March.
tourism_level.pricing: Peak prices and very limited availability around St. Patrick's Day. Book accommodation months ahead. Prices may decrease after, depending on Easter.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Massively festive and crowded around St. Patrick's Day, with a strong party vibe. Calmer later, unless Easter brings another surge.

events_holidays.name: Limerick St. Patrick's Festival & Parade
events_holidays.description: Major city parade on March 17th, plus often concerts, street entertainment, and family events over the weekend. Huge buzz city-wide.
events_holidays.notes: Parade day is extremely busy. Find viewing spots early. Check official festival website (Limerick.ie) for full schedule. Pubs are packed.

events_holidays.name: International Band Championship (Part of Festival)
events_holidays.date: Often Sunday of St. Patrick's Weekend (check dates)
events_holidays.description: Marching bands from Ireland and abroad compete, parading through the city centre.

events_holidays.name: Easter Weekend (if applicable)
events_holidays.description: Good Friday/Easter Monday are public holidays. Expect increased domestic tourism, some closures (shops, services). Religious events held.
events_holidays.notes: Confirm opening hours. Book accommodation/transport far ahead if Easter falls in March.

unique_experiences.activity: Experience the Limerick St. Patrick's Day Parade
unique_experiences.where: Parade Route through City Centre (e.g., O'Connell Street)
unique_experiences.description: Witness the large, colourful parade celebrating Irish culture with community groups, bands, and performers.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Arrive very early (hours) for a good viewing spot along O'Connell Street. Dress for the weather (layers, waterproofs). Expect massive crowds.

unique_experiences.activity: Soak Up the St. Patrick's Day Pub Atmosphere
unique_experiences.description: Dive into the festive spirit in Limerick's pubs. Expect live music, green everywhere, singing, and very crowded spaces.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Pubs will be extremely busy; finding space can be challenging. Go early or be prepared to stand. Enjoy the energy.

unique_experiences.description: On a brighter day after the St. Patrick's Day festivities, enjoy a walk along the river as spring emerges.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Wrap up, as it can still be cool and windy by the river. Paths are paved.

unique_experiences.description: Explore Limerick's oldest building, offering a peaceful indoor contrast to the potential crowds or unpredictable weather outside.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check visitor opening times around any Lenten or Easter services if applicable.
